alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:40PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central West Feliciana, St. Helena, northern Livingston, East Feliciana, northern Tangipahoa and northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes, southwestern Pike, southeastern Wilkinson and Amite Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Liberty to Roseland. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Clinton, Liberty, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Kentwood, Centreville, Independence, Roseland, Slaughter, Gloster, Wilson, Osyka, Norwood, Montpelier, Darlington, Wilmer, Pride and Felps. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 38 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; West Feliciana
